subject: Re: [junit] RE: Why doesn't JUnit count asserts?
msgSnippet: ... I find that asserts improve the readability of the test and can be used to document the tester s intentions. Cheers, Kevin
messageBody:
rainsber@ca.ibm.com wrote:
The following test case has no assertions...

public void testIllegalArgumentException() {
    try {
        MyClass myClass = new MyClass(null);
        fail("Created myClass with null argument.");
    }
    catch (IllegalArgumentException success) {
    }
}

...should I be worried that this test isn't good enough?

I find that asserts improve the readability of the test and can be used to document the tester's intentions.

Cheers,
    Kevin
